definition: to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
old variant of 兜[dou1]
pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
pen (pig)/a fold
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Don't beat around bush. Just give it to me straight.
sentences.chinese: 别兜圈子了，对我有话直说吧。

sentences.english: The aircraft circled around over the landing strip …
sentences.chinese: 飞机在着陆跑道上空兜圈子。

sentences.english: Tell me what has happened as it is, don't beat about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 如果告诉我究竟发生什么了，不要兜圈子。

sentences.english: Tell me the truth,don’t beat around the bush.
Maybe you feel as if you've been wandering in circles forever.
sentences.chinese: 也许你感到仿佛一只在兜圈子。

sentences.english: He doesn't answer my question but be faring off the mark of go around in circles.
sentences.chinese: 他不回答我的问题而是不着边际的兜圈子。

sentences.english: Now move the hand to and fro and around but not up and down.
sentences.chinese: 让手来回动或兜圈子，但不能上下动。

sentences.english: Give thyself time to learn something new and good, and cease to be whirled around.
sentences.chinese: 给出时间来学习新的和好的东西而停止兜圈子吧。

sentences.english: You can say this to someone who is telling you something in a roundabout way.
sentences.chinese: 有人兜圈子告诉你什么事情，你就可以这样对他说。

sentences.english: Do you seem to be driving around all day like Kyle?
sentences.chinese: 你是否像K一样看起来在整天开车兜圈子？

sentences.english: He hemmed and hawed around and didn't tell me what I wanted to know.
sentences.chinese: 他支支吾吾地兜圈子，就是不肯说出我要知道的问题。

sentences.english: Finally he slowed down and all the other bats excitedly milled around him.
sentences.chinese: 最后它慢下来，所有其他的蝙蝠兴奋地围着它兜圈子。

sentences.english: Remember how we used to have to work around them?
sentences.chinese: 还记得我们过去总得跟他们兜圈子的事吧？

sentences.english: Life always makes a full circle.
Why was he now taking so circuitous a route?
Otherwise you go round and round in circles.
sentences.chinese: 否则你只是在来回兜圈子。

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
to talk in riddles
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
bend/turn/curve
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
to play tricks on sb
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to play tricks on sb
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
